articles.author: Steve Holland, Gram Slattery, Tim Reid
articles.description: The president-elect said he would not rule out using military or economic action to acquire the overseas Danish territory after he takes office on Jan. 20.
articles.title: Trump looks to Greenland to cement his legacy and expand sphere of US influence

articles.author: Jorge Garcia, Michael Blake
articles.description: More than 30,000 people evacuated their homes as a wildfire ripped through an upscale coastal area of Los Angeles overnight, with Hollywood celebrities among those fleeing by car and on foot as flames engulfed homes and set hillsides ablaze.
articles.title: Hollywood stars among thousands fleeing Los Angeles-area wildfires

articles.author: Hyunsu Yim
articles.description: A Realmeter poll showed the PPP's approval rating was at 34.4%, up for three consecutive weeks.
articles.title: As South Korea's impeached president Yoon awaits fate, his party sees signs of revival

articles.author: Joe Cash, Ryan Woo
articles.description: Authorities moved more than 45,000 people in earthquake-hit Tibet to shelters in a massive rescue operation at the foot of the Himalayas as they wound down the search in a high-altitude environment where the odds of survival were always slim.
articles.title: Focus shifts to Tibet earthquake survivors as search called off

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: As talks continued in Qatar, the Israeli military carried out strikes across the enclave, killing at least 17 people, Palestinian medics said.
articles.title: U.S., Arab mediators make some progress in Gaza peace talks, no deal yet, sources say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Lebanese lawmakers began voting in a presidential election on Thursday, aiming to fill a post which has been vacant since 2022, with political sources expecting army commander General Joseph Aoun to be elected.
articles.title: Lebanese lawmakers start voting on new president

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Yoon Kab-keun, one of the lawyers representing South Korea's impeached President Yoon Suk Yeol, said on Thursday that Yoon was staying in his official residence.
articles.title: Lawyer for South Korea's Yoon says impeached president in official residence

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Mozambique opposition leader Venancio Mondlane returned home on Thursday, after fleeing in the days following a hotly contested October election that sparked demonstrations in which scores of protesters have been killed.
articles.title: Mozambique opposition leader returns after fleeing on post-election safety fears

articles.author: Ann Wang
articles.description: Taiwan's navy simulated on Thursday an effort to see off enemy ships as it wrapped up three days of New Year drills, sending two of its newest and most advanced warships to lead a flotilla into the Taiwan Strait.
articles.title: Taiwan navy shows off its steel with simulated attack exercise

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A Russian guided bomb attack on Wednesday killed at least 13 people and injured 113 in Ukraine's southeastern city of Zaporizhzhia, authorities said.
articles.title: Russian strike kills 13, injures 113 in Ukraine's Zaporizhzhia
